intro: Oxymitra mortehanii, commonly known as the Cape fennel, is a herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as parsley and dill. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white to yellowish flowers in umbels. It is often cultivated for its edible leaves, which have a mild, anise-like flavor. Oxymitra mortehanii thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable addition to Mediterranean-style gardens.
